name: NCT03640312_secondaryOutcomeMeasure_7_OutcomeAnalysis_9_BetweenGroupAnalysis_OG000_OG001
title: Health-related Quality of Life at 12 weeks Statistical Analysis for QUARTET LDQT vs Candesartan in NCT03640312
description: Statistical test for difference in Mental Health T Score

note.text: Data are available on only 28 participants in the intervention group for the mental health T score.

variableDefinition.description: Group Assignment: QUARTET LDQT vs. Candesartan

observed.display:
Group Assignment: Patients randomized to the intervention arm took a once daily ultra-low-dose quadruple combination therapy (QUARTET LDQT). The LDQT is an overencapsulated combination pill comprising four types of blood pressure lowering medications each at ¼ standard doses. QUARTET includes candesartan 2mg, amlodipine besylate 1.25mg, indapamide 0.625mg, and bisoprolol 2.5mg. The individual components are currently approved and marketed within the United States.

QUARTET LDQT: Ultra-low-dose combination therapy comprising four different blood pressure lowering drugs at 1/4 dosages. Taken once daily for 12 weeks. vs. Patients randomized to the comparison arm took a once daily 8mg candesartan.

Candesartan: Standard monotherapy of 8mg candesartan. Taken once daily for 12 weeks.
Health-related Quality of Life at 12 weeks (NCT03640312)

note.text: Adjusted for baseline mental health T score
